sbol:Collection.dcterms:title: iGEM Parts Registry
sbol:Collection.dcterms:description: The iGEM Registry is a growing collection of genetic parts that can be mixed and matched to build synthetic biology devices and systems. As part of the synthetic biology community's efforts to make biology easier to engineer, it provides a source of genetic parts to iGEM teams and academic labs.

sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:title: BBa_K594000
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dcterms:description: a luxI homologous AHL synthetase from Sinorhizobium meliloti 1021
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableDescription:
The S. meliloti strain Rm1021 harbors at least two quorum-sensing systems; one of them is sinR/sinI system, The sinI is responsible for the production of several novel AHLs, including C12-HSL, 3-Oxo-C14-HSL, C16:1-HSL, 3-Oxo-C16:1-HSL, C18-HSL, some of theses are the longest AHLs identified so far. The sin system correlates with a delay in the appearance of nitrogen-fixing nodules, as well as with an overall decrease in the number of pink nodules, suggesting a role for quorum sensing in establishing a successful symbiosis with Medicago sativa.
As a autoinducer synthatase, the use of sinI is the same with luxI, namely to produce AHLS.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.dc:creator: Yu Xiaoyan
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableProvenance: SinI is from the Sinorhizobium meliloti 1021. We get its gene sequence from the www.microbesonline.org, and then cloned them through PCR with biobrick part primers.
sbol:ComponentDefinition.sbh:mutableNotes: The Sinorhizobium meliloti 1021 is a mode organism in Rhizobia. so We got the S. meliloti 1021 from Nanjing Agriculture University easily, and then cloned the sinI gene from S. meliloti 1021 with primers designed by the part design tool in the website ginkgobioworks.com.
